articles.author: Laura Sanicola, Shariq Khan
articles.description: U.S. motorists are squeezing out one last trip before Memorial Day holiday and school begins, as pump prices surge to their highest level this year on tighter gasoline supplies.
articles.title: U.S. gasoline prices at year high, tight supply weighs on motorists

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.description: U.S. retail sales increased more than expected in July as Americans boosted online purchases and dined out more, suggesting the economy continued to expand early in the third quarter and keeping a recession at bay.
articles.title: Amazon helps US retail sales power ahead in July

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tesla (TSLA.O) introduced new standard range Model S and Model X cars in the United States, priced at $78,490 and $88,490, respectively, the electric carmaker's website showed on Monday.
articles.title: Tesla introduces new Model S and X cars in US

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Norway's wealth fund, the world's largest single stock market investor, posted a profit of 1,501 billion crowns ($143 billion) in the first half of the year, driven by strong equity markets and a weak crown currency, the fund said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Norway wealth fund posts $143 bln profit as AI surge lifts tech

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Crypto exchange Binance late on Monday filed for a protective court order against the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission saying the regulator's requests for information were "over broad" and "unduly burdensome".
articles.title: Binance files for protective order against SEC

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: New York state on Tuesday fined Avis Budget Group (CAR.O) $275,000 for refusing to rent vehicles to customers who did not have credit cards.
articles.title: New York fines Avis Budget for denying car rentals to people who lack credit cards

articles.author: David Carnevali
articles.description: Esmark Inc majority owner and chief executive James Bouchard said in an interview on Tuesday that his steel maker, which does not publicly report its earnings, has cash for its $7.8 billion bid for U.S. Steel Corp (X.N) sitting in his bank account.
articles.title: Esmark CEO says has money in bank account for $7.8 billion US Steel bid

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Donald Trump is likely to claim that his right to free speech and genuine concerns about voter fraud protect him from charges that he pressured Georgia officials to change the results of the 2020 election in his favor.
articles.title: Georgia indictment: How will Trump defend himself? Will it work?

articles.author: Nelson Bocanegra
articles.description: In May, a forum bringing together leaders debating wind and solar development in Colombia's La Guajira province was disrupted by a chorus of passionate opposition.
articles.title: Focus: Colombia's potential renewables boom short circuits on Indigenous resistance

articles.author: Vladyslav Smilianets
articles.description: Less than 30 km (19 miles) from Ukraine's southeastern front line, rural farmers whose businesses have survived Russian rockets now fear another hammer blow to their livelihoods: rock-bottom prices for their harvest.
articles.title: Ukraine's frontline farmers face Russian rockets and rock-bottom prices
